title: Process and Project Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Widener (Chester, PA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Did a phone Interview as first step in the process, general overview of experience and provided a good overview of position. Questions about my experience. I was invited to the second round of interviews but I decided to decline.
Interview Questions: Experience with data modeling/process workflow development

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Widener (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: All day interview, 1:1 with faculty , then opportunity to talk with current students and talk with other faculty at lunch. Reviewed program structure as a group. Faculty questions were personal and professional
Interview Questions: What strengths do you have that have helped you get here and how will they carry you through the program.

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Widener in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: No process. It is just favoritism. If you are called, just please everyone saying SIR etc. They mostly present a rosy picture with no real intentions to give you things if you join
Interview Questions:
Would you not leave us soon? Or can you come on weekends and night with no additional pay?
Can you teach classes not in your area of expertise ? Can you travel for 10 hrs by car for outreach ?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Widener
Interview Descriptions: It was a fairly informal group interview. First, I met with the Dean. Then, I participated in a group interview with the faculty search committee. All of the faculty were really nice. It felt like we were having a group discussion more than anything. Finally, I was given a tour of the campus. I would have loved to work there, but the salary was much too low and they weren't willing to budge.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you dealt with a difficult student. How did you handle that situation?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Widener
Interview Descriptions: I was given the job over the phone with no interview. This was the easiest interview that I ever had. I was referred by a current employee and I'm alumni, so that had to help.
Interview Questions: The only question was "Do you have a Master's Degree".

title: Campus Safety Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Widener (Chester, PA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I met with the Assistant Director and then the Directors of Campus Safety. Many of the questions revolved around my interest in the position and what made me apply to the position. They clearly stated the details of the position and what a typical day would involve. They both were very courteous and welcomed me to the campus.
Interview Questions: What made you apply for this position?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Widener
Interview Descriptions: One phone-screen interview. Invited back one month later for second round. 2nd round was in-person interview meeting director first, then a committee second, close-out meeting with director at end of afternoon.
Interview Questions: Why, in particular, did you choose to apply to WU?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Widener in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Great, friendly, really upbeat interview.  Learned a lot about the school, the students, goals of the program, what teaching there is like and what the rest of the interview process would be.  Also learned how long the decision process would be for the school and when they would get back to me.  Overall, really good.
Interview Questions: did i have past teaching experience

title: Director, Development Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Widener
Interview Descriptions: I met the VP outside of normal channels and was offered a job without really interviewing.
Interview Questions: Do you have any development experience?

title: Switchboard Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Widener (Chester, PA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: very quick. very formal. hired on the spot, started in a week. lady was very nice, didnt ask any hard questions. very nice. gae me a tour the same day

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Widener (Chester, PA) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Job was posted online, and it asked to email the office. Office responded that very day and emailed back an application that needed to be turned in before the interview. Once the application was received, there was emailed for an interview. Interview was more causal. I filled out some online information for background check. Once given the ok, you are assigned to a school and can start when the school notifies you.
